original: Björkman, Per Erik Thorsten, telegrafkommissarie, Norrköping, f. 1/11/ 81 i Lista, Södermani. 1., av kontr:-prosten Erik B. o. Sigrid Segerbrand. G. 11 m. Vera Johansson. Barn: Erik f. 12, Karin 15. — Mog:ex. 01, ex. v. telegr:v. und :visn :anst. 02. Telegr:-assist. i Eskilstuna 04, kontrollör i Norrköp. 19, telegr :komm. i Hudiksvall 29, i Västerås 37 o. i Norrköp. 41-46, pens. 46. RVO.
translated: Björkman, Per Erik Thorsten was a telegraph commissioner born on November 1st, 1881 in Lista, Södermani. He was the first child of the contract-provost Erik B. and Sigrid Segerbrand. He was married to Vera Johansson in 1911 and they had two children: Erik, born in 1912, and Karin, born in 1915. Björkman began working as a telegraph operator in 1901 and continued in the field, eventually becoming a telegraph commissioner. He worked as a telegraph assistant in Eskilstuna in 1904, a controller in Norrköping from 1919, a telegraph commissioner in Hudiksvall in 1929 and in Västerås in 1937. He returned to Norrköping as a telegraph commissioner from 1941 until his retirement in 1946. Björkman received the Royal Patriotic Society's Medal (RVO).
